member.name: T:Google.Maps.CacheOptions
member.summary: Encapsulates map data caching parameters.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.CacheOptions.BasePath
member.summary: The base directory used for storing cache files. If this string value is empty, then `BasePath` defaults to .

member.name: F:Google.Maps.CacheOptions.Directory
member.summary: The directory under `BasePath` used for storing cache files.
member.remarks: Note: Files in this directory can be deleted on cache cleanup. Do not put other files in this directory.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.CacheOptions.MaxDiskBytes
member.summary: The maximum amount of space (in bytes) to allocate for cache files.
member.remarks: The total can exceed this value temporarilyâ€”in between cache cleanup passes. Set this value to to *0* to use an unlimited amount of space. This maximum is applied independently to two different caches - map features (the Features directory) and terrain (the Terrain directory). If terrain is enabled then the actual maximum disk space used is double this value. Note: If you are targeting WebGL (which is not officially supported), then set this value to *0*.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.CacheOptions.DiskTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Maximum time to wait to read from the disk cache. If a read takes longer than this, the disk cache is disabled.
member.remarks: Set this value to 0 to wait indefinitely. This is a workaround for a known bug that causes Musk to hang waiting for the disk cache. When behaving correctly, reading from the disk cache should be fast.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.CacheOptions.Copy
member.summary: Creates a shallow copy of this object.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1
member.summary: A disjoint set is a data structure that maintains a partitioning of a set into disjoint subsets (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disjoint-set_data_structure).

member.summary: Creates a new, empty DisjointSet.

member.summary: Returns the set associated with the supplied element.

member.returns: The set associated with the supplied element.
member.exception: If the supplied element is not associated with a set.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.AddInitialEntryIfElementAbsent(`0)
member.summary: Adds a new element to this DisjointSet if it is not currently present.
member.param: The element to add if not already present.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.SubsetUnion(`0,`0)
member.summary: Combines the subsets associated with the two supplied elements.
member.remarks: If either element is not currently in this DisjointSet, a single element subset containing that element is created before performing the combination.
member.param: The first element.
The second element.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.GetSetRepresentative(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{`0})
member.summary: Returns a representative element from the supplied set.
member.remarks: A representative element is an arbitrary element contained in the set. This is useful for selecting a key with which to identify this set in the pool of subsets in this DisjointSet structure (valid because all subsets are disjoint, so the representative element cannot also be present in any other subset).
member.param: The set of values from which to draw a representative.
member.returns: A representative element from the values set.
member.exception: If the set is empty.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.GetRepresentative(`0)
member.summary: Returns a representative element from the set associated with the supplied element.
member.remarks: See for an explanation of "representative element". This is not a stable representative, changing the set associated with the supplied element may change the representative returned by this function.
member.param: The element from whose associated subset the returned representative is selected.
member.returns: A representative element from the subset associated with element.
member.exception: If the element is not associated with any set.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.GetSets
member.summary: Returns a set of the subsets currently contained in this DisjointSet.
member.remarks: Returns a newly allocated outer HashSet, but the elements within that set are the actual subsets stored internally, so these should treated as readonly.
member.returns: The set of subsets.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string displaying contained subsets separated by commas.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Collections.Generic.DisjointSet`1.SetToString(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{`0})
member.summary: Returns a string representing the supplied set in the form "{value1, value2}".
member.param: The set from which to generate a string representation.

Insertion:O(1)

Enumeration (per item):O(1)

member.summary: Gets a collection containing the keys in , in insertion order.
member.remarks: Each key in the returned collection is a reference to the actual key in the dictionary. Therefore, changes to the keys in the collection will result in changes to the keys in the dictionary.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords
member.summary: Encapsulates management aspects of the coordinate system.
member.remarks: Manages the floating origin, Mercator scale, and converts between %Unity Worldspace (Vector3), Earth-scale Mercator Space () and %Google %Maps Tile Coordinates (). Caution: You must set the floating origin before using the Coordinate System. For more information, see the method.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.Zoom
member.summary: The zoom level.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.IsFloatingOriginSet
member.summary: Whether has been set.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords._FloatingOrigin
member.summary: A backing field for .

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.FloatingOrigin
member.summary: Floating origin, stored as a Vector2D point in Earth-scale Mercator space.
member.remarks: When converting to/from %Unity Worldspace, Vector3 values are translated relative to this point (in order to avoid single precision floating point number stability issues).

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords._MercatorScale
member.summary: A backing field for .

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.MercatorScale
member.summary: Mercator scale factor.
member.remarks: When converting to/from Unity Worldspace, Vector3 values are scaled relative to this value. The ideal Unity Worldspace scale is 1:1 (1 unit = 1 meter), however in the Mercator Projection, scale varies by latitude (1 at the equator, 2 at 60 degrees and infinity at the north pole). Instead of attempting to rescale the world as users move north/south, The SDK locks the scale to the initial origin's latitude. This means that the world slowly changes size as users move north/south, however in location-based games users are not expected to move far enough or fast enough for this to be noticeable.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Zoom.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.InitFloatingOrigin(Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng)
member.summary: Establishes the initial floating origin and Mercator scale of the coordinate system.
member.param: Initial coordinate system floating origin value.
member.exception: If the floating origin has already been set.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.MoveFloatingOrigin(Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng)
member.summary: Moves the floating origin (used when converting values to/from ).
member.remarks: The floating origin should be moved whenever the user moves far enough that floating point stability issues become a concern (the density of representable floating point numbers decreases as their magnitude increases). After calling this method, you should use the returned offset value () to translate all s in the scene (ie. to reposition them closer to the new floating origin and hence reduce the magnitude of their floating point values).
member.param: New floating origin value.
member.returns: A offset for manually translating s to reposition them relative to the new floating origin.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.FromLatLngToVector3(Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng)
member.summary: Converts a `LatLng` value into a %Unity Worldspace `Vector3` by way of the Spherical Mercator projection: - translated relative to the current origin (). - scaled relative to the latitude of the initial floating origin ().
member.param: The LatLng value to convert.
member.returns: A Vector3 value in %Unity Worldspace.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Coord.Coords.FromVector3ToLatLng(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Converts a %Unity Worldspace `Vector3` into a `LatLng`, by way of the Spherical Mercator projection.
member.remarks: This method is the inverse of the method. It takes into account the fact that the Vector3 has been translated relative to the current origin, and scaled relative to the latitude of the initial origin.
member.param: The `Vector3` value to convert.
member.returns: The converted `LatLng` value.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.Earth.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the Earth, in meters, according to the spherical Earth model used by Google Maps (itself based on the major equatorial radius of the WGS 84 ellipsoid).

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.Earth.Circumference
member.summary: The circumference of the Earth, in meters.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Coord.EarthMercator
member.summary: Earth-scale Spherical Mercator Projection.
member.remarks: Scaled so that at the equator, the distance spanned by a full 360 degrees of longitude is equal to the circumference of the Earth (in meters).

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.EarthMercator.Extent
member.summary: Size of Earth-scale Mercator Projection space along the x axis.
member.remarks: For square projections (ie. with truncated latitude), this also applies to the y axis.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng.Lat
member.summary: The latitude value.
member.remarks: Valid values are in the range: [-90, 90]. Values outside this range are clamped (rounded). For example, the value 100 would become 90, and the value -100 would become -90.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng._Lat
member.summary: Serializable Latitude field exposed to the Unity inspector. Its value can be accessed programmatically through .

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng.Lng
member.summary: The longitude value.
member.remarks: Valid values are in the closed interval: [-180, 180]. Values outside this range are wrapped. For example, the value -190 would become 170, and the value 190 would become -170. This is because longitudes wrap around the globe. Both -180 and 180 are allowed (they both correspond to the Antimeridian).

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng._Lng

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Coord.Mercator
member.summary: Implementation of the Spherical Mercator Projection, also known as the "Web Mercator" projection (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Mercator).
member.remarks: Mercator space is finite in width (x) but infinite in height (y). "x" corresponds to longitude (in radians), while "y" is a function of latitude and spans an infinite range. As "y" gets larger, points get closer to the north pole but never quite reach it. The north and south poles have infinite "y" values.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Coord.TileCoord.GetChildTileCoords(Google.Maps.Coord.TileCoord)
member.summary: Calculates all child tiles of tileCoord by subdividing it into four corresponding s of the next incrementing zoom level.
member.remarks: Note: One of zoom level i is comprised of four s of zoom level (i+1). The relationship between tileCoord and its child tiles: Before subdivision: ----------------- | | | | | | | x, y | | | | | | | ----------------- After subdividing into its child tiles: -------- -------- | | | | 2x, | 2x + 1,| | 2y | 2y | -------- -------- | | | | 2x, | 2x + 1,| | 2y + 1 | 2y + 1 | -------- --------
member.param: Tile Coordinates.
member.returns: List of tileCoord's child tiles.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Event.Events
member.summary: Encapsulates the set of all events fired by the SDK.
member.remarks:
%Events are part of a mechanism that allows you to style map feature GameObjects. They are fired from various stages of the map feature construction pipeline. The SDK fires `WillCreate` and `DidCreate` events whenever it constructs a and its corresponding during map loading. These events contain geometry and metadata information that you can use to style map feature s.
For more information, see [GameObject creation](/maps/documentation/gaming/tt/concepts_musk#gameobject_creation).

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Event.LoadMapChunkEvent
member.summary: Event that is triggered after the collection of map features belonging to a chunk has been fetched and is ready to be loaded into the game world (e.g. through the creation of game objects). The collection supersedes any collection previously loaded for the chunk. Chunks do not share features. The features belonging to a chunk may change over time. This event may be triggered multiple times for the same chunk without any intervening invocation of for that chunk. Chunks are distinguished by identifiers valid only with reference to a particular instance. This event triggers in tandem with other map feature loading processes, e.g. the creation of gameplay objects, but there are no specific guarantees about their relative ordering or timing. This event can be used to create extra game objects or load other data structures derived from map features.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Event.UnloadMapChunkEvent
member.summary: Event that is triggered when a chunk is ready to be unloaded from the game world. This can be used to destroy extra game objects or unload other data created using . This event may be triggered multiple times for the same chunk without any intervening invocation of .

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Event.MapEvents
member.summary: Encapsulates the set of events related to fetching and loading the map.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapEvents.LoadStart
member.summary: Fired immediately before a part of the map begins to load after calling .

remarks.para: If you call `LoadMap` more than once before earlier calls have finished loading (e.g., while quickly panning around the map), then the event is triggered only once.

Be careful when loading or unloading map regions within this callback as this may cause infinite callback loops. To be safe, consider deferring additional loading until after the LoadStart event has completed.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapEvents.Loaded
member.summary: Fired when all and objects from calls to have been loaded.
member.remarks:
If you call `LoadMap` with an area that has already been loaded, then it triggers the event immediately.
If you call `LoadMap` more than once before earlier calls have finished loading (e.g., while quickly panning around the map), then the event is triggered only onceâ€”after everything has loaded.
If there are errors while loading, then will be non-zero, and some MapFeatures might not be ready. Call LoadMap again to retry.
Be careful when loading or unloading map regions within this callback as this may cause infinite callback loops. To be safe, consider deferring additional loading until after the Loaded event has completed.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapEvents.LoadError
member.summary: Fired when part of the map fails to load.
member.remarks: You get fine-grained control over retry behavior by modifying the arguments to this event. For more information, see .

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapEvents.Progress
member.summary: Fired whenever a part of the map finishes loading.
member.remarks: This event allows you to track map loading progress. So for example, you could use it to drive a progress bar.

member.summary: An error occurred at the network level. The SDK did not receive a response from the Semantic Tile API.
member.remarks:

Loss of network connection. Consider checking .
The request exceeded its deadline. Consider increasing .

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapLoadedArgs.Errors
member.summary: The number of network errors since the last `MapLoaded` event.
member.remarks: If this value is zero, then all s from calls to before this event are ready. If this value is non-zero, then there might be parts of the map that didn't load successfully. To retry, call `LoadMap` again.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Event.MapLoadedArgs.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Event.MapLoadErrorArgs
member.summary: Encapsulates the set of arguments for .
member.remarks:
When part of the map fails to load after a call to , a event is fired before attempting to load it again. A listener can modify the fields of `MapLoadErrorArgs` to change whether it will retry, and if so, after what delay. The default behavior starts with a delay of 0.5 seconds with 1.0 jitter, doubling the delay with each attempt, up to 3 attempts.
Recommendations
Handle events and log to the console.
On , notify the user that they must update the app.
If requests regularly time-out ( with == "Request timeout"), then consider increasing .
If requests time-out mainly on slow networks, consider increasing the number of retries instead (set to true if <= a value greater than 3).
Don't change or .
Example

member.summary: Indicates whether the request can be retried.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapLoadErrorArgs.Retry
member.summary: Indicates whether to retry loading this part of the map.
member.remarks: %Event listeners can modify this value to change the behavior. But it has no effect if is true.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapLoadErrorArgs.TimeoutSeconds
member.summary: The number of seconds to wait for the response from the server after sending the next request.
member.remarks: If set to 0, the next attempts waits forever.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Event.MapLoadErrorArgs.DelaySeconds
member.summary: The length of time to wait before retrying.
member.remarks: %Event listeners can modify this value to change the behavior.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.GlobalCoordinate.MercatorCoordinates
member.summary: Immutable Global Mercator Space integer coordinate.
member.remarks: For the finest supported tile zoom factor (17) these values will range over: [0, 2^17 * 4096]. Also note: the Y coordinate of the 2D integer coordinate increases to the north, as opposed to the canonical coordinates-within-tile representation in which Y value grows to the south.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.GlobalCoordinate.WorldSpaceCoordinates
member.summary: Mutable Unity world space coordinates.
member.remarks: Note: Y value increases to the north, as opposed to the canonical coordinates-within-tile representation in which Y value grows to the south.

member.summary: Get the list of edge sequences built so far.
member.remarks: If there is a partial, unterminated current sequence, it will be ignored. So it is important to call TerminateSequence on the last edge sequence.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.WindingOrder
member.summary: Specifies the winding order of a triangle. Degenerate indicates that triangle has zero area, and thus no determinable winding order.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.Vertices
member.summary: Vertices that make up the Area's border. This is relative to the .

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.VertexBreaks
member.summary: Separates the Area's vertices into discrete intervals, each one that describes an individual polygon.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.Triangles
member.summary: Triangles that make up an Area's polygon. A triangle is represented as a triplet of indices into the Area's Vertices array.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.ZOrder
member.summary: The z-order of this area, as returned in the tile data from Factile.

members.member: For each vertex, stores the next vertex in the polygon boundary loop. You can use this to check whether an edge is external to the polygon.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.ExternalEdges
member.summary: Contains whether each edge in the area is external to the feature. An external edge is one that borders another feature. These external edges may be used for styling. For example, when drawing borders around regions, they should only be drawn on the external edges of the area. Currently, this field is only supported for the AdministrativeArea1, Locality, and Sublocality feature types. This array will always have the same number of elements as the Vertices array. For each vertex index i, the edge from vertex i to NextVertexInLoop[i] is external iff ExternalEdges[i] is true.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.Vector2},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs an area with no external edges. Included for backwards compatibility.
member.param: The vertices that make up the Area's border.

When you separate the Area's vertices into discrete intervals, each one describes an individual boundary loop of the area. You can use this to check whether an edge is external to the area. Each vertex break is an index into the vertices array, and indicates the start of a new loop. For example, if there are 10 vertices, and a break at vertex index five, then vertices 0-4 comprise one loop, and vertices 5-9 comprise another loop.
A collection of integer triples that make up the Area's triangles. Each integer is an index into the collection of vertices.
The z-order of this Area. Defaults to zero.
Determines whether the newly created Area will have its coordinates modified to be relative to the center of its bounding box. See also, Recenter().

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.Vector2},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Boolean},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The %Area class constructor.
member.param: The vertices that make up the Area's border.

When you separate the Area's vertices into discrete intervals, each one describes an individual boundary loop of the area. You can use this to check whether an edge is external to the area. Each vertex break is an index into the vertices array, and indicates the start of a new loop. For example, if there are 10 vertices, and a break at vertex index five, then vertices 0-4 comprise one loop, and vertices 5-9 comprise another loop.
A collection of integer triples that make up the Area's triangles. Each integer is an index into the collection of vertices.
Indicates which of the edges are external to the area and border another feature. This should be the same size as the vertices parameter.
The z-order of this Area. Defaults to zero.
Determines whether the newly created Area will have its coordinates modified to be relative to the center of its bounding box. See also, Recenter().

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.GenerateBoundaryEdges
member.summary: Returns a list of lists of vertices, each inner list representing a contiguous edge run for this Area.
member.remarks: The returned edge runs will form closed loops in anticlockwise winding order. This means that the outside of the Area is to the right of each edge.
member.returns: A List of connected edge sequences, each sequence represented by a list of vertices where each a list of n vertices represents n - 1 contiguous edges: [v0, v1], [v1, v2], ..., etc. The vertices are in world space.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.GenerateExternalBoundaryEdges
member.summary: Returns a list of lists of vertices, each inner list representing a contiguous edge run for this Area. Only external boundary edges will be returned.
member.remarks: The returned edge runs will form closed loops in anticlockwise winding order. This means that the outside of the Area is to the right of each edge. This method will return only the edges that are external to the map feature (that is, they border another feature). This makes this method good for adding borders to regions.
member.returns: A List of connected edge sequences, each sequence represented by a list of vertices where each a list of n vertices represents n - 1 contiguous edges: [v0, v1], [v1, v2], ..., etc. The vertices are in world space.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.getNextVertexInLoop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the next vertex in an edge loop. Useful for getting the boundaries of an area.
member.param: An index into the Vertices list.
member.returns: An index into the Vertices list representing the next vertex in the edge loop.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Area.MakeAnticlockwise
member.summary: Changes the edge loops and triangle indices of the area so that they form anticlockwise loops.
member.remarks: This makes it easier to construct extruded buildings with the walls facing the right way.

member.remarks: The main job of this method is to preserve the Origin in the clone. This is achieved by setting the recenter parameter to the constructor to false (to prevent modification of the supplied s) then copying the Origin by calling on the clone.

Is the height value server-supplied?

member.returns: The generated ExtrudedArea.

member.summary: Closeness factor used to determine if a vertex is close to a boundary.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Line.CanonicalTileSize
member.summary: Tile size in unscaled tile coordinates.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Line.Vertices
member.summary: The vertices that make up the Line.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Line.IntVertices
member.summary: Integer versions of the vertices that make up the Line, locating the vertices in a world scale Mercator based integer coordinate system.
member.remarks: The coordinate system combines tile coordinates and infra-tile coordinates, essentially: TileCoordinate * 4096 + InfraTileCoordinate These integer vertex values are globally unique, immutable (in that they are not affected by or ), and maintained in addition to the floating point vertices for the purpose of more accurate feature coordinate matching for intersection detection and road lattice generation. As this is a publicly visible feature class, Vector2 and Vector2Int values are stored in parallel in order not to break existing client code that accesses the float vertices. This will be required til such time as we move to a unified integer-plus-float representation of vertices throughout the SDK, such as the type.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Line.VertexOnTileBoundary
member.summary: Indicates whether the corresponding vertex in the array lies on a tile boundary.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Line.ZOrder
member.summary: The z-ordering of the line. Lines with a higher z-order are rendered above lines with a lower z-order.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.Line.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Google.Maps.Feature.Shape.GlobalCoordinate},System.Int32)
member.summary: A `%Line` constructor that accepts both float and integer versions of vertices in the form of values.
member.remarks: See comments for an explanation of why we need to extract the integer and float versions into separate arrays rather than storing the original GlobalCoordinate values. The provision of arguments in the form of values obivates the need to provide some kind of error handling for the case where the number of integer and float vertices does not match, and provides a path to a potential future where all coordinates are specified this way.
member.param: Collections of vertices in integer-plus-float format
Z-order of the line

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.SegmentishStyleBuilder
member.summary: The %SegmentishStyle builder.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.SegmentishStyleBuilder.Material
member.summary: A material to apply to the segment.
member.remarks: Meshes created using the style default to %Unity's default MeshRenderer material in the event that no material is provided. The default value is *null*.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.SegmentishStyleBuilder.Width
member.summary: The width of the Segment, in meters. The default value is *10*.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.SegmentishStyleBuilder.BorderMaterial
member.summary: A material to apply to the border of the segment.
member.remarks: If a value for `%BorderMaterial` isn't set, then this value will be *null*, and no border is drawn. If a value is set, then an additional GameObject is created to represent the border of the Segment. This GameObject is a child of the primary GameObject, and is identical except for width, which is controlled by and . To be effective, this material should have all of the properties of a normal basemap material, but with a value that causes it to be rendered between basemap features and the primary segment . The border material is intended for use with roads of a single flat color. If a value for `%BorderMaterial` is set, then the z-ordering for roads won't work. This works fine for flat colored roads, but `%BorderMaterial` should not be used with textured roads.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.SegmentishStyleBuilder.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the Segment border, in meters. The default value is *1*.
member.remarks: The `%BorderWidth` is applied outside the segment. For example, a segment with `%Width` of *10* and `%BorderWidth` of *1* will have a total width of *12* meters. `%BorderWidth` is applied only when a is not *null*.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.Material
member.summary: A material to apply to the segment.
member.remarks: Meshes created using the style default to %Unity's default MeshRenderer material in the event that no material is provided. The default value is *null*.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.Width
member.summary: The width of the Segment, in meters. The default value is *10*.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.BorderMaterial
member.summary: A material to apply to the border of the segment.
member.remarks: If a value for `%BorderMaterial` isn't set, then this value will be *null*, and no border is drawn. If a value is set, then an additional GameObject is created to represent the border of the Segment. This GameObject is a child of the primary GameObject, and is identical except for width, which is controlled by and . To be effective, this material should have all of the properties of a normal basemap material, but with a value that causes it to be rendered between basemap features and the primary segment . The border material is intended for use with roads of a single flat color. If a value for `%BorderMaterial` is set, then the z-ordering for roads won't work. This works fine for flat colored roads, but `%BorderMaterial` should not be used with textured roads.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Feature.Style.SegmentishStyle.BorderWidth
member.summary: The width of the Segment border, in meters. The default value is *1*.
member.remarks: The `%BorderWidth` is applied outside the segment. For example, a segment with `%Width` of *10* and `%BorderWidth` of *1* will have a total width of *12* meters. `%BorderWidth` is applied only when a is not *null*.

member.summary: ID of the currently running coroutine, or 0 if there's no running coroutine.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Logging.LogsService.LastCoroutineId
member.summary: ID of the last run coroutine, or 0 if no coroutines have been run yet.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Logging.LogsService.LoggingInterval
member.summary: Time to wait between sending logs.
member.remarks: We choose a per-player random offset within this interval and store it in (see ). For example, a player with an offset of 3 minutes would send logs at :03, :18, :33 and :48 every hour (if the is active at that time). This meets the requirements to (a) send logs no more frequently than every 15 minutes; (b) smear logs over time, i.e. don't send from every device in the world at the same time on the 15 minute mark; and (c) send some logs even if game sessions are less than 15 minutes long.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Logging.LogsService.LoggingOffsetKey
member.summary: Key for storing the logging window offset seed in .
member.remarks: Note that we store the seed used to calculate the offset, not the offset itself. This has the (minor) advantage that could change and existing seeds would still work.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.Load(Google.Maps.GameObjectOptions)
member.summary: Loads the portion of the map defined by this region at the zoom level specified by the .
member.param: Game object options. Ignored if a component is attached to the same as the relevant .

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.LoadWithZoom(Google.Maps.GameObjectOptions,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads the portion of the map defined by this region, at the specified zoom level.
member.param: Game object options. Ignored if a component is attached to the same as the relevant .

The magnification level. The range is 0-21. If no zoom level is supplied, the one from *Coords.Zoom* will be used instead. Caution: Zoom level controls the level of detail of map data, and determines the size of the map "tiles" returned. The higher the zoom level, the more detail is returned, which negatively affects performance.
The default zoom level is *17*. This zoom level is considered appropriate for location-based games because lower zoom levels tend to miss some important map features. Zoom level 17 is also more stable, which means the returned map features are less likely to change over time.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.Load(Google.Maps.GameObjectOptions,Google.Maps.Loading.MixedZoomOptions)
member.summary: Loads the portion of the map defined by this region, with adaptive zoom.
member.remarks: This loads at zoom level up to a distance of world space units from the . After that, it reduces the zoom level by 1 in bands that double in size, starting with . See for details.
member.param: Game object options.
Mixed zoom options.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.SetLoadingPoint(System.Nullable{UnityEngine.Vector3})
member.summary: Sets the point in world space where tiles should load first.

remarks.para: The SDK loads tiles in an order that corresponds to their distance from this point.
The tiles that are closest to this point are loaded first, and then more distant tiles are loaded.

member.param: The point in world space where tiles should load first. You can set this to null, which results in the default unordered tile loading behaviour.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.SetGroundHeight(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the height of the ground plane.
member.remarks: This changes how the region is projected onto the area of the map to load - for example, it changes the plane that the camera frustum is projected onto for . It does not change the position of loaded map features.
member.param: Y position of the ground plane.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.AddViewport(UnityEngine.Camera,System.Single)

summary.para: Adds an area to the map region based on the camera's view frustum.

member.remarks: The loaded area of the map is limited by the camera's far clip plane. If this loads too much, especially at shallow camera angles, then it can be limited further by `maxDistance`. It also loads the Camera to access the camera data in the scene. `camera` is used to sort the tiles based on their distance from the camera before loading so that tiles that are closest to the camera load first. Note: Calling this method multiple times with different cameras simply sorts the tiles by distance from the last `camera`.
member.param: The camera used to limit the area of the map loaded. It is also used to determine which tiles to load first.
The maximum distance from the camera position to load.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapLoadRegion.AddViewport(UnityEngine.Camera,UnityEngine.Transform,System.Single)

summary.para: Adds an area to the map region based on the camera's view frustum and given transform.

member.remarks: The loaded area of the map is limited by the camera's far clip plane. If this loads too much, especially at shallow camera angles, then it can be limited further by `maxDistance`. It also loads the Camera to access the camera data in the scene. `camera` is used to sort the tiles based on their distance from the camera before loading so that tiles that are closest to the camera load first. Note: Calling this method multiple times with different cameras simply sorts the tiles by distance from the last `camera`.
member.param: The camera used to limit the area of the map loaded. It is also used to determine which tiles to load first.

The used to transform the area of the map region to be loaded. This is usually the of the corresponding component to ensure that the right amount of geometry is loaded to fill the viewport whenever it is rotated or scaled.
The maximum distance from the camera position to load.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.PlayableLocationsService.ReportBadPoint(System.String,Google.Maps.PlayableLocationsService.BadLocationReason,System.String,Google.Maps.ReportBadPointStatusCallback)
member.summary: Submits a bad place report to the server.
member.remarks: After the request finishes, the ReportBadPointStatus parameter of the callback is populated with information about whether the request succeeded. Internally, the network requests are retried multiple times in case of failures. Note:`reasonDetails` must be non-empty.
member.param: The ID of the place to report.
The primary reason why this is a bad place for gameplay.
Freeform text explaining why the user reported this place.
The callback to call when the request completes.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.PlayableLocationsService.ReportPresentedPlace(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Reports that a game object placed at this playable location was presented to the user.
member.remarks: %Google uses the information logged in `ReportPresentedPlace` and `ReportInteractedPlace` to improve the quality of playable locations. This is done by comparing how often game objects placed at different playable locations are visited by players. Because different game object types (for example, monster and powerup) are expected to be visited with different frequencies, you must assign a `gameObjectType` to each playable location (for example: monster=0, powerup=1). This is used to bucket reports into comparable events. There should be only a small number of unique game object typesâ€”ideally no more than 10. You can call this method repeatedly with the same Place IDs. The SDK only reports places to the server if they haven't been reported before, or if the player interacted with the game object placed at the playable location since the last report. Note: You are free to define what presented means, as long as you use that definition consistently. One possibility is to report all playable locations the lie within 500 meters of the player.
member.param: The type of game object placed at this playable location.
The place identifier.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.PlayableLocationsService.ReportInteractedPlace(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Reports that the user interacted with the game object placed at this playable location.
member.remarks: For more information about `gameObjectType`, see ReportPresentedPlace().
member.param: The type of game object placed at this playable location.
The place identifier.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.MapsService
member.summary: The %MapsService class serves as the entry point for interacting with the %Maps %Unity SDK.
member.remarks: The SDK instantiates this class as a %Unity script component called %Maps Service (Script). You use it in a %Unity scene by adding the %Maps Service (Script) component to an empty in your scene. This GameObject becomes your anchorâ€”and the map feature GameObjects that the SDK generates are added as its children. You can configure options using the Inspector, but you cannot change most options after calling (for example, you cannot change the ). However, you can create multiple %MapsService instances, each with different properties. For example, you could add a bird's-eye mini-map with a different zoom level to your main map.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.SemanticTileApiAddress
member.summary: The domain address of the Semantic Tile API.
member.remarks: If you modify this field after calling , then your change won't take effect.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.UseHttpForSemanticTileRequests
member.summary: When true, uses http instead of https when sending requests to the Semantic Tile API.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.ApiKey
member.summary: The API key. You must have both the Semantic Tile API and the Playable Locations API enabled. For more information, see Get API Key.
member.remarks: Note: If you modify this field after calling , it has no effect.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.NetworkPoolSize
member.summary: Maximum number of concurrent connections to the Semantic Tile API.
member.remarks: If you use a value less than 100, then you should expect longer load times for map data. Warning: This field is experimental. Its value might change in a future release.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.NetworkTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: The maximum length of time (in seconds) to wait for a response after requesting map data.
member.remarks:
When you set this value to 0, there is no limit to the wait time. Note: This attribute is an integer rather than a floating point due to a limitation of the
UnityWebRequest object.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnableDiagnostics
member.summary: Specifies whether to send diagnostic information to Google. An example of diagnostic information is frame rate.
member.remarks: Caution: You must set this value before the %Unity runtime calls .

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService._Events
member.summary: A backing field for .
member.remarks: The backing field appears in the %Unity Inspector (due to ) while keeping the public property readonly.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.MapsService.Events
member.summary: A container for all of the events fired by the SDK.
member.remarks: Events are part of the mechanism that allows you to style map feature GameObjects. For example, the SDK fires `WillCreate` and `DidCreate` events when it generates objects and their corresponding during map loading. These events contain geometry information and metadata that you can use to style the GameObject.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnableModeledStructures
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable features.
member.remarks: When set to false, features are used instead, which results in reduced network traffic, CPU usage, and memory usage. If you modify this field after is called, then your change won't take effect.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnablePrivateRoads
member.summary: Specifies whether loaded map will include roads () that are marked private. A road may be marked private because it has signage discouraging or prohibiting use by the general public (e.g., roads with signs that say "Private", or "No trespassing.") or if it is within a gated community or other private area. Care should be taken when enabling private roads in localities where encouraging gameplay around these roads is discouraged by local expectations.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnableTerrain
member.summary: Specifies whether the loaded map will include terrain data. Terrain data describes continuous properties that cover the entire landscape, such as elevation.
member.remarks: Note: Terrain elevation is only available for zoom levels 8 and beyond. If elevation is requested for levels out of this range, a flat terrain with a uniform altitude of zero meters above mean sea level will be returned.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.ObjectCreationFrameBudget
member.summary: The maximum length of time (in milliseconds) per frame to use for creating GameObjects.
member.remarks: Setting this to 0 defaults to 40ms. This field can be modified at any time to change the current rate of creating GameObjects.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.StaticBatching
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable static batching for all generated GameObjects.
member.remarks: When enabled, GameObjects are statically batched, unless otherwise specified in the corresponding `WillCreate` event. If you modify this field after calling , then your change won't take effect.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.TerrainOptions

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnableIntersections
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable the display of extra geometry at road intersections.
member.remarks: This will add a slight map loading overhead and small increase in number of triangles rendered per frame.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnableExhaustiveIntersectionReconstruction
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable extra, expensive searching for road intersections.
member.remarks: This flag can be used to find road intersections that have been optimized out of the source data.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.EnableRoadLattice
member.summary: Specifies whether to build and maintain a road lattice from the roads in the currently loaded portion of the map.
member.remarks: Enabling this will add overhead to each load of a non-cached map region.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.MapsService.ZoomLevel
member.summary: The map zoom (magnification) level.
member.remarks: Controls the level of detail of map data (the set of feature types returned, their density, and geometry simplification). This determines the size of the requested map tiles. The default zoom level is 17â€”which is considered appropriate for location-based games because lower zoom levels can miss important features such as buildings. Zoom level 17 is also considered more stable, meaning the set of features returned is less likely to change. If you modify this field after is called, then your change won't take effect.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapsService.LoadMap(UnityEngine.Bounds,Google.Maps.GameObjectOptions)
member.summary: Loads a rectangular region (bounds) of the map.
member.remarks: GameObjects are asynchronously created for all map features within the bounds that you specify. Note: You must set the origin to before calling this method. Calling this function is equivalent to calling `LoadMapRegion().Bounds(bounds).Load(options)`.
member.param: Defines a rectangular region.
User defined options which customise map construction.
member.exception: Thrown when the floating origin isn't set.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapsService.MakeMapLoadRegion
member.summary: Initializes a object to load a region of the map.
member.remarks: GameObjects are asynchronously created for all map features within the bounds that you specify. You must set the floating origin to before calling this method. The MapLoadRegion returned by this method is cleared and reused between calls to avoid unnecessary garbage collection.
member.example:
The following example loads the region of the map visible in the main camera's viewport.
MapsService.MakeMapLoadRegion().AddViewport(Camera.main).Load(options);

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapsService.UnloadUnused(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Unloads parts of the map that have not been loaded or displayed recently.
member.param: Anything that hasn't been used in at least this long will be destroyed.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapsService.InitFloatingOrigin(Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng)
member.summary: Sets the initial origin of the coordinate system.
member.remarks: When converting values to and from %Unity Worldspace, values are translated relative to the current origin. The initial origin value is used to determine the %Unity Worldspace scale for the entire gaming session. Mercator scale is based on the latitude, per the Web Mercator projection. The recommended `floatingOrigin` value to use is the player's starting location. It should be near the player's current location to ensure that %Unity Worldspace values remain small to avoid single precision floating point errors.
member.param: The initial origin value.
member.exception: Thrown when the origin has already been set.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapsService.MoveFloatingOrigin(Google.Maps.Coord.LatLng,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.GameObject})
member.summary: Re-establishes the origin based on a new value.
member.remarks: You should re-establish the origin whenever the user moves far enough away from the origin that floating errors become noticeable. This method translates all map feature s created by the SDK. You can pass in additional GameObjects to be translated. You can also use the returned offset value to manually translate additional GameObjects yourself. This method is an overload of the method . See Also: .
member.param: The new origin value.
Additional s to be translated (if there are any).
member.returns: A offset that you can use for manually translating s to reposition them relative to the new origin.
member.exception: Thrown when the origin has not been set.
member.example:
The following code snippet re-establishes the origin to London. Two camera objects are also moved, to keep all GameObjects in the same position relative to the camera.
MapsService.MoveFloatingOrigin( new LatLng(51.5081, -0.0760), new GameObject[] {camera1, camera2});

member.name: M:Google.Maps.MapsService.MoveFloatingOrigin(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.GameObject})
member.summary: Reestablishes the origin based based on a new [Vector3](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Vector3.html) value.
member.remarks: This method is an overload of the method .
member.param: The new origin as a `Vector3` value.
Additional s to be moved (if there are any).
member.returns: A offset value, for manually moving s.
member.exception: Thrown when the floating origin has not been set.

member.summary: Specifies the target resolution of each generated Unity Terrain tiles in meters per point.

remarks.para: The actual resolution of each terrain tile may differ from the provided value. Unity tiles have square height maps with their resolution as a power of 2 + 1. The Maps Unity SDK rounds the provided value to the nearest power of 2 + 1 to meet this requirement.

remarks.para: The actual resolution of the alpha maps may differ from the provided value. Unity tiles must have square alpha maps with a power of two resolution. The Maps Unity SDK will round the provided value to the nearest power of two to meet this requirement.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Terrain.TerrainStyle.BaseMapResolutionMetersPerPixel
member.summary: The target resolution in meters per pixel of the composite texture used on the terrain when viewed from a distance greater than the Basemap distance.

remarks.para: The actual resolution of the base map may differ from the provided value. Unity tiles must have square base maps with a power of two resolution. The Maps Unity SDK will round the provided value to the nearest power of two to meet this requirement.
When used with Mixed Zoom, this value is automatically doubled for each increment the zoom level is lowered.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Terrain.TerrainStyle.BaseMapDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance at which terrain textures will be displayed at full resolution. Beyond this distance, a lower resolution composite map will be used for efficiency.

member.summary: The s applied to each Terrain tile during styling.

member.summary: Decodes the contents of a tile.

Decode the first non-null valid content in the following order:
.Content
.Serialized

member.name: T:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree
member.summary: Quad-tree of Mercator tile coordinates.
member.remarks: This implements the algorithm described in go/musk-hot-swapping. There are two overlapping sets of tiles: Loaded (which we've loaded and turned into GameObjects) and Ideal (which we'd like to render given the current viewport). The goal is to find the set of Loaded tiles that best cover the area represented by the Ideal tiles.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node
member.summary: One node in the quad-tree.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.Coord
member.summary: Tile coordinates for this node.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.Children
member.summary: Child nodes. The of each non-null child is a child of this node's .
member.remarks: The child nodes are indexed in LRTB order; i.e. the children of a tile with coords (x, y, zoom) are {(2x, 2y, zoom+1), (2x+1, 2y, zoom+1), (2x, 2y+1, zoom+1), (2x+1, 2y+1, zoom+1)} in that order.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.Parent
member.summary: Parent node. If null, this is the root node.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.Loadedness
member.summary: Number representing whether this tile is loaded. 0 means not loaded; 1 means loaded; any number in between means partially loaded (note that the number doesn't reflect how much of the tile is loaded).

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.IsIdeal
member.summary: Whether this tile is in the Ideal set.
member.remarks: This class assumes that there is at most one Ideal tile in any path from the root to a leaf node.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.IdealArea
member.summary: Proportion of this tile covered by the Ideal set, from 0 to 1.
member.remarks: If this tile is ideal or it has an ideal ancestor, then IdealArea is 1. If this tile has ideal descendants, then IdealArea is (sum of Children.IdealArea) / 4.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.Weight
member.summary: Weight of this node, defined as MinCoverage ^ abs(Coord.Zoom - Ideal tile zoom).

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.#ctor(Google.Maps.Coord.TileCoord)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Coordinates of this node.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.AddDescendant(Google.Maps.Coord.TileCoord)
member.summary: Adds the given as a descendant of this node, adding as many intermediate nodes as necessary.
member.remarks: This method is idempotent; adding a node that already exists does nothing, and returns the original node. A can be added as a descendant of itself (and will return this node).
member.param: Descendant tile coord.
member.returns: Node representing the descendant.
member.exception: If is not a descendant of .

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.AddParent
member.summary: Returns the parent of this node, creating it if necessary.

member.summary: Sets to false and to 0 for this node and its descendants.

member.summary: Sets the values of and for this node and its descendants.
member.param: Whether this is a descendant of the ideal tile in this branch of the tree.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Node.FindBestRenderSet(System.Collections.Generic.List{Google.Maps.Coord.TileCoord},System.Int32@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Calculates the best render set for a subtree, and returns its score.
member.param: List of tile coordinates representing the best render set from the portion of the tree that has been traversed so far. On exit, the last entries cover the subtree corresponding to this node; if a node higher up the tree chooses a better-scoring set, it should replace the last entries.
Output - the number of tile coords at the end of representing this subtree.
Output - score for the last elements of as the Render set for this subtree.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.MinCoverage
member.summary: The minimum coverage of loaded tiles that will be preferred for the render set over full coverage one zoom level further away from the ideal.
member.remarks: Numbers close to 1 give fewer gaps in the render set. Called "fudge factor Î±" in go/musk-hot-swapping.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.PartiallyLoadedScore
member.summary: Score multiplier for partially loaded tiles.
member.remarks: As long as this is a very small positive number, partially loaded tiles will be rendered if and only if there's nothing else to show there.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.MixedZoom.QuadTree.Root
member.summary: Root node.
member.remarks: This is the common ancestor of all nodes in the tree. If a node is added that is not a descendant of the root, its common ancestor with the root becomes the new root, and all the intermediate nodes are added to keep it connected.

member.returns: Tree node corresponding to the tile coord.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.FeatureTileDecoder.BuildAreaFromTriangleFan(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.Vector2})
member.summary: Decodes an from a Triangle Fan.
member.remarks: The first vertex is the center of a triangle fan. The other vertices are arranged around this vertex in a fan shape. The following diagram shows a triangle fan polygon with the vertices labelled with their indices. Vertices may be in either a clockwise or counterclockwise order. (1) / \ / \ / \ (0)-----(2) / \ / / \ / / \ / (4)-----(3) Visible for testing.
member.param: The triangle fan to decode.

member.summary: Builds an from a set of Indexed Triangles.
member.remarks: The polygon is a set of triangles with three vertex indices per triangle. (0) (4) / \ / \ / \ / \ (1)----(2) (3)----(5) Visible for testing.
member.param: Vertices.
Loop breaks.
Indices.
Whether each edge is external or not.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.FeatureTileDecoder.BuildAreaFromTriangleStrip(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.Vector2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Builds an Area from a Triangle Strip.
member.remarks: A strip of triangles, where each triangle uses the last edge of the previous triangle. Vertices may be in either a clockwise or counterclockwise order. (0) / \ / \ / \ (2)-----(1) / \ / / \ / / \ / (4)-----(3) The triangulation generated from the above example is [0, 2, 1, 1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 3] Visible for testing.
member.param: Vertices.
If set, vertices in triangle strip will be permuted to be a simple outline loop.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.FeatureTileDecoder.ReloopTriangleStripVertices(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.Vector2},System.Int32[],System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{UnityEngine.Vector2}@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Permutes vertices of a triangle strip representation to a simple loop representation. For example (0) (4) / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ (2)-----(1) => (3)-----(0) / \ / / \ / / \ / / \ / / \ / / \ / (4)-----(3) (2)-----(1) Original triangulation topology is retained, but with updated vertex positions. E.g. Triangulation: [0, 2, 1, 1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 3] => [4, 3, 0, 0, 3, 1, 3, 2, 1] Visible for testing.
member.param: The original vertices of the triangle strip
The original triangulation
Output for updated, reordered vertices
Output for updated triangulation

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.FeatureTileDecoder.TriangleStripFromVertexIndices(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32})
member.summary: Constructs a triangle strip from a given list of vertex indices.
member.remarks: A triangle strip is constructed such tha each triangle uses the last edge of the previous triangle. Vertices may be in either a clockwise or counterclockwise order. (0) / \ / \ / \ (2)-----(1) / \ / / \ / / \ / (4)-----(3) Generated from the indices list [0, 1, 2, 3, 4]. The triangulation generated from the above example is [0, 2, 1, 1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 3] Visible for testing.
member.param: The list of vertex indices used in calculating the triangle strip.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TerrainTileDecoder.UnpackBytes(Google.Protobuf.ByteString,System.Int32)
member.summary: Decodes a byte string into an array of integers. The encoding is nibble-based; the first nibble contains a sign bit, two bits of the integer, and a stop bit; subsequent nibbles contain three bits of the integer and a stop bit. Small integers can be represented in a single nibble. More details in go/enduro-fast-compact-heightmaps.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TileCache`1.LoadTile(Google.Maps.TileLoading.TileParameters,Google.Maps.TileLoading.TileCache{`0}.Result)
member.summary: Asynchronously loads the tile with the given .
member.remarks:
The steps to load a tile are as follows:
Look for the 4x4 containing this tile in the in-memory . If it's not there, look for it in . If it's not on disk, create an empty block.
Look up the for this tile. If it has expired, clear it.
If the has a , return it immediately.
If the has SVT, parse it to a and return it.
If we get this far, fall through to .LoadTile (which will typically load from Factile over the network). If this succeeds and the response contains SVT, save it to , parse it into a MapTile, and return it.

member.summary: A special Priority Queue used for things like parsing tiles.
member.remarks: This class is essentially a stack of FIFO blocks.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TilePriorityQueue.Token
member.summary: Priority token. Each of these represents an entry in the queue. They are activated in the order that they occur in the , with the maximum number of active tokens limited by the parameter to the constructor.
member.remarks: Tile processing should call (or ) to get a token; wait until is true; then do whatever processing it needs to, and then the token.

member.summary: Position of this token in .

member.summary: Whether this token is active.

member.summary: Constructor.

Tile coordinate.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TilePriorityQueue.Token.Prioritize
member.summary: Moves this token in front of the queue's priority tail.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TilePriorityQueue.Token.Release
member.summary: Releases this token. If it is active, the next inactive token in the queue will be activated.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TilePriorityQueue.List
member.summary: The list of tokens given out by this queue, in priority order.
member.remarks: Tokens are activated starting from the head of the list, but later reordering (e.g. adding new nodes before the priority tail) can mean that there are inactive tokens in front of active ones.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TilePriorityQueue.Count
member.summary: Number of items in the queue.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.TileLoading.TilePriorityQueue.PriorityTail
member.summary: The most recent node in this Queue that is not part of the last region to be added. moves elements just before this node.
member.remarks: When is called, if any tiles in that list have already been loaded and parsed, we want to prioritize GameObject creation for those tiles. However, we also want to keep them in the same order that they appear in that list. A simple stack or queue doesn't work, because the new tiles need to be FIFO amongst themselves but LIFO with respect to the rest of the list. So: - When prioritizing a tile, we move it to just before the current priority tail. This preserves the order among tiles moved since the last , but puts them ahead of all other tiles.

member.summary: Calls to aren't guaranteed to happen in a specific order relative to *AssemblyReloadEvents.beforeAssemblyReload*, so we need to enforce the relative order of calls to and using this flag. If this flag is true, it means that OnDisable has been called since the last called to OnEnable (and that OnEnable has been called).

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Unity.GameObjectManager.Google#Maps#Unity#IGameObjectManager#ActivateObjects(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Google.Maps.Coord.TileCoord})
member.summary: Activates GameObjects corresponding to the given collection of tiles, and deactivates everything else.
member.remarks: Tile coordinates that are not in are silently ignored. The only common case where this happens is for tiles that contain no features. Other than that, it should be rare, since only calls this with coordinates of loaded tiles. This uses explicit interface implementation to avoid having to make it public. It effectively gives it the same visibility as since callers need to refer to the interface.
member.param: The collection of tiles to activate.

member.summary: Combines two nodes into a single node at the supplied location where the combined node will have connections to all nodes that were connected to either of the supplied nodes.
member.remarks: The source nodes may contain non-disjoint sets of neighbors. This will not result in multiple links to/from the combined node to any given neighbor.
member.param: The location of the generated, combined node.
One node to combine.
Another node to combine.
member.returns: The generated, combined node.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Unity.Intersections.RoadLattice.AddLatticeSegment(Google.Maps.Unity.Intersections.RoadLatticeSegment)
member.summary: Adds a to this lattice by iterating through the vertices of the segment, creating a at the location of each vertex, with nodes corresponding to adjoining vertices becoming neighbors.
member.remarks: If a vertex is marked as being on a tile boundary, the created node will also be marked as being on a tile boundary. Newly created nodes are added to this lattice using the ALLOW_MERGE option, so if this lattice contains a node at the same location as a vertex from the added segment, then the newly created node (corresponding to the vertex in question) is merged into the existing node. This has the effect of generating intersections where added segments intersect at a vertex. Where two segments cross but do not both have a vertex at the crossing point, this process does not create any new nodes.
member.param: The RoadLatticeSegment to add.

member.summary: Finds the nearest node in the to the supplied position.
member.remarks: This is a proof of concept brute force implementation. Performance is O(n), where n is lattice.GetNodes().Count.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Unity.MeshUtils
member.summary: A collection of utility functions for operating on Unity meshes.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Unity.MeshUtils.CombineSubMeshes(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Combines the meshes of a target and source mesh, each of which both have 2 submeshes, while preserving the submeshes, and preserving the world space location of source mesh.
member.remarks: After calling this method the target object will have two submeshes, with each submesh being the result of merging the corresponding submesh from source and target. objects.
member.param: The target object.
The source object
member.exception: If the number of submeshes is not incorrect. This function should never be called with such GameObjects.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Unity.MeshUtils.CombineUntransformedSubMeshesWithOffset(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Merges the submeshes from source to target in target local space using the supplied offset.
member.remarks: Merges the source mesh onto the target mesh without considering the current world space transform of the target, but adds the supplied offset to the effective position of source before merging. This is in contrast to , which merges the source mesh onto the target incorporating current world space relative transforms (i.e., takes into account the relative positioning etc. of the meshes in world space).
member.param: The target onto which to merge submeshes from source.
The source of the merged submeshes.
An offset to add to the vertices of source before merging.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Unity.MeshUtils.CombineSubmeshesWithTransform(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Matrix4x4)
member.summary: Combines the meshes of a target and source mesh, each of which both have 2 submeshes, using the local coordinate space of each mesh, but transforming source mesh with the supplied transformation matrix before merging.
member.remarks: Meshes are merged using their respective local spaces, i.e., generating vertices that are relative to the respective meshes origin, but the source vertices are transformed by the supplied matrix before merging. This can be used to combine meshes while maintaining world space relative position by calculating the transform matrix from source local space to target local space (as done in ) or using any arbitrary local space relative transform, such as the relative offset used in .
member.param: The target mesh object onto which the merge is performed.
The source mesh object.
The transformation applied to source mesh vertices.
member.exception: If invalid meshes are passed.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.CoordsUtil.FromVector2DToVector3(Google.Maps.Coord.Vector2D,System.Double,Google.Maps.Coord.Vector2D)
member.summary: Converts a Vector2D value (Earth-scale Mercator space) into a Vector3 (Unity Worldspace), by translating relative to the floatingOrigin and scaling relative to the mercatorScale.
member.param: The Vector2D value to convert.
Mercator scale factor.
Floating origin in Earth-scale Mercator space.
member.returns: A Vector3 value in Unity Worldspace.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.CoordsUtil.FromVector2DToVector3NoWrapping(Google.Maps.Coord.Vector2D,System.Double,Google.Maps.Coord.Vector2D)
member.summary: Converts a Vector2D value (Earth-scale Mercator space) into a Vector3 (Unity Worldspace), by translating relative to the floatingOrigin and scaling relative to the mercatorScale without crossing or wrapping around the antimeridian - should be used when the longitude is needed to be in the range of -180 degrees to 180 degrees which goes all around the world.
member.remarks: Antimeridian is the line at -180/180 longitude. Crossing the antimeridian ensures that the longitude stay all positive or all negative. (i.e. 170 degrees to -170 degrees (340 degrees apart) becomes 170 degrees to 190 degrees (20 degrees apart)) However, when it is comes to converting a large, low zoom level to Bounds, crossing the antimeridian causes its Bounds to be lot smaller than it is as we do want the Bounds of to go all the way around the world.
member.param: The Vector2D value to convert.
Mercator scale factor.
Floating origin in Earth-scale Mercator space.
member.returns: A Vector3 value in Unity Worldspace.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.CoordsUtil.FromVector3ToVector2D(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Double,Google.Maps.Coord.Vector2D)
member.summary: Converts a Vector3 value (Unity Worldspace) into Earth-scale Mercator space (Vector2D).
member.remarks: Inverse of (ie. takes into account that the Vector3 value would have been translated relative to the floatingOrigin" and scaled relative to the mercatorScale.
member.param: The Vector3 value to convert.
Mercator scale factor.
Floating origin in Earth-scale Mercator space.
member.returns: A Vector2D value in Earth-scale Mercator space.

member.remarks: The conversion is lossy, since TileCoord space is less granular than Vector3 space. See: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/maptypes#TileCoordinates
member.param: The Vector3 value to convert.
Zoom level.
Mercator scale factor.
Floating origin in Earth-scale Mercator space.
Whether to limit the tile coords to the extents of tile coord space at this zoom level.

member.remarks: For convenience, the south-west corner of the tile is chosen, since this corresponds to the local tile origin in Vector3 space. Inverse of .

Zoom level.
Mercator scale factor.
Floating origin in Earth-scale Mercator space.

member.summary: Whether the coroutine has finished.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.CoroutineResult`1.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the coroutine and its child sub-coroutines.
member.remarks: This is typically called from outside the coroutine. Calling code should yield the return value to wait until the coroutine has actually finished. This depends on the coroutine to check periodically. If the coroutine doesn't handle the cancellation (either because it doesn't check at all, or because was called too late and the coroutine is ready to return), then has the same effect as .

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.CoroutineResult`1.WaitUntilAllDone
member.remarks: It is implicit that coroutines should wait for child routines that they care about the result of to be done before returning. This method is useful for tests.

member.summary: Waits for this coroutine to be done.
member.remarks: Does not wait for its children to finish.

member.summary: Tries choosing a random circle with specified radius.
member.remarks: Must meet the following conditions: * The circle is completely inside a specified . * The nearest distance from any point on the circumference to the 's boundary is not less than . * The circle does not collide with any circle given in . This use the randomized algorithm with specified number of tries. In case of success, this method returns true and pass out the resulting representing the position of the center of the randomised circle via parameter. Otherwise, returns false.
member.param: An area in which to randomly place a circle.
The boundary edges of the .
A radius of the circle to place.
A minimum distance from the boundary of an .
A maximum number of tries to random a circle.
A collection of existing circles.
A position of the center of the resulting circle.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter
member.summary: Utility class for insetting triangulations. Given a triangulation and optional wavefront edge velocities is able to compute the resulting polygon after allowing the wavefront edges to propagate inwards for some amount of time. Additionally computes the straight skeleton of the polygon (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straight_skeleton).

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.DefaultVelocity
member.summary: Default velocity of the s if none is specified.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.Time
member.summary: The current time to which the polygon has been inset relative to the original polygon.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.InitialTriangulation
member.summary: The initial triangulation used to construct the insetter.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.Owners
member.summary: For each directed edge in the triangulation, the triangle to which it belongs, oriented such that the edge in question is the AB edge of the triangle.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.EventQueue
member.summary: The event queue for the scanplane algorithm.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.StraightSkeletonAdjacencies
member.summary: For each vertex in the straight skeleton, the set of vertices with an edge to this one.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.StraightSkeletonFrontier
member.summary: For each wavefront vertex in the straight skeleton, the vertex from which it originated.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.#ctor(Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Triangulation2,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Edge{System.Int32},System.Single})
member.summary: Constructs an insetter at zero inset distance. Assumes a perfect triangulation of a simple polygon with holes. A perfect triangulation contains no internal vertices, including vertices between pairs of collinear edges.
member.param: The triangulation to inset.
Optional velocities for each external edge.
member.exception: Thrown when the triangulation is invalid.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.Run(System.Single)
member.summary: Inset the polygon until the given time, then stop.
member.param: The time to inset to.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.HandlePointEvent(Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.Event,Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.OrientedTriangle)
member.summary: Point events occur when a triangle collapses to a point. The relevant triangle is removed from the triangulation.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.HandleEdgeEvent(Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.Event,Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.OrientedTriangle)
member.summary: Edge events occur when one edge of a triangle collapses to a point. The vertices at either end of the edge are replaced with a new vertex and the triangle is removed from the triangulation.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.HandleSplitEvent(Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.Event,Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.OrientedTriangle)
member.summary: Split events occur when an edge is split in two by a vertex. The relevant vertex is split into two and its adjacent triangles updated depending on which side of the original triangle they are on. The original triangle is then removed.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.HandleFlipEvent(Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.Event,Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.OrientedTriangle)
member.summary: Flip events occur when the triangulation would contain a negative triangle. The quad formed by the two triangles that share this edge is flipped to be triangulated the other way around to avoid one of the triangles becoming negative.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.GetInitialTriangulation
member.summary: Get the initial triangulation that is being inset.
member.returns: The initial triangulation.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.Insetting.TriangulationInsetter.GetTriangulation
member.summary: Get the triangulation at the current time.

member.summary: Compares Vector2s radially around a given origin.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.RadialComparison.RadialComparer.#ctor(UnityEngine.Vector2)
