member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.RadialComparison.RadialComparer.Pseudoangle(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: A monotonic function in the range [0, 4) on the angle of . Based on the piecewise-monotonic function f((x, y)) = x / (abs(x) + abs(y)). Observe that we can scale the vector without changing the result of this function, so it is purely dependent on direction. Consider now some unit-length vector rotated by some angle around the origin. For the range [0, PI/2], x decreases monotonically, and the denominator never drops faster than x, as it is simply (x + y) in this quadrant, and y must be increasing, so the rate of change of (x + y) is strictly greater than that of x. It follows that f decreases monotonically from 1 to 0. Similar arguments exist for the other quadrants to show that f is monotonic in each quadrant, and indeed that it monotonically decreases over the domain [0, PI] and monotonically increases over [PI, 2PI]. As the vector rotates, f describes a V-shape from (0, 1) to (PI, -1) and back to (2PI, 1). By negating the section of this function in the domain [0, PI] (where y >= 0), we get a piecewise monotonically increasing function. Adding 1 in the domain [0, PI) and 3 in the domain [PI, 2PI), we can make this function continuous and strictly positive. As such we now have a monotonically increasing, continuous, and strictly positive function in the angle of the vector which we refer to as the pseudoangle due to its relationship to the angle of the vector itself.
member.remarks: This is theoretically more stable than Unity's trigonometric functions.
member.param: The vector to find the pseudoangle of.
member.returns: The pseudoangle of the vector.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.Geometry.RadialComparison.RadialComparer.Compare(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Compares and radially around , in the continuous range of angles [0, 2*PI).
member.param: The left hand vector.
The right hand vector.
member.returns: Negative if is less than , 0 if equal, and positive if greater.

member.summary: Performs Gaussian Elimination (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaussian_elimination) with full pivoting. Solves systems of linear equations of the form AX = B for X given A and B. The determinant of A is computed as a side effect. Runs in O(N^3)
member.param: An N by N matrix A.
An N by M matrix B.
The determinant of A, which is zero if no solution exists.
member.returns: The solution X such that AX = B, or null if no solution exists.
member.exception: When the given matrices are the wrong shape.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.MatrixUtils.MatrixInverse(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double@)
member.summary: Computes the matrix inverse of , or null if none exists. Matrices must be square to be invertible. The inverse of an N x N matrix is another N x N matrix such that their product is the identity matrix, I. The determinant of is computed as a side effect.
member.param: The matrix to compute the inverse of.
The determinant of , which is zero if is not invertible.
member.returns: The inverse of , or null if is not invertible.
member.exception: Thrown when is not square.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator
member.summary: A convenience class for dealing with loop break lists (arrays of indices) such as VertexBreaks in .
member.remarks: Provides an index iterator that monitors the array of loop breaks and provides IsLoopStart and IsLoopEnd predicates.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.Breaks
member.summary: Loop breaks, indicating indices that correspond to the start of a loop.
member.remarks: The 0 index is implied, but may be explicitly included.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.MaxValue
member.summary: The upper bound (inclusive) of the iterator.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.CurrentValue
member.summary: The current iterator value. Initialised to -1 before iteration begins.
member.remarks: A value equal to indicates the iterator is exhausted.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.BreaksIndex
member.summary: Index into the array of the start of the next loop that starts at a value greater than or equal to .
member.remarks: If CurrentValue is not at the start of a loop, this will refer to the start of the next loop. When the iterator moves past the first index of a loop, this value is updated to refer to the start of the next loop. Initially, CurrentValue == -1, and BreaksIndex == 0.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new iterator using the supplied breaks array.
member.param: The maximum value returned by this iterator.
An array of indices, each corresponding to the start of a loop.

Optional parameter indicating whether to take a local copy of the breaks array. Defaults to false, so the original breaks array is used, requiring that the array not be modified while the iterator is being used.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Allows iterator to be used in foreach loops. This object is its own IEnumerator.
member.returns: Reference to this object

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.MoveNext
member.summary: Moves the iterator to the next value while updating the field if necessary.
member.remarks: If the current iterator value corresponds to the start of a loop break, is incremented to refer to the next loop break start.
member.returns: False if the iterator is exhausted.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.Reset
member.summary: Resets the iterator. Apparently only used for COM interoperability in DotNet.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.Current
member.summary: Returns the current value in a type safe way.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.IsLoopStart
member.summary: Returns whether the iterator's current value refers to the first index of a loop.

member.name: P:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.IsLoopEnd
member.summary: Returns whether the iterator's current value refers to the last of a loop.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.LoopBreakIterator.CheckInRange
member.summary: General guard function to prevent the iterator being used in an invalid state, e.g., before the iterator has moved to the first item, or after the iterator is exhausted.
member.exception: If iterator value undefined.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Util.Log
member.summary: Logging utility class.
member.remarks: The Verbose* methods in this class are used to log verbose messages (that is, messages that are relevant for SDK developers and developers using the SDK) to the Unity console. These methods are simple wrappers around the Unity.Log* methods that only generate output if: * The SDK was built with the DEBUG flag, and * the client explicitly turned on verbose logging via the method. This is to ensure that verbose logging doesn't affect release builds or clog up the console. NUnit tests should set "Debug.logger.logEnabled = false" to ensure that calls to Debug.Log() don't generate runtime exceptions (Debug.Log() cannot be called outside of a Unity project).

Object to which the message applies.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Util.OrderPreservingMap
member.summary: Automatically builds a partial map from a finite integer domain to a finite integer codomain (both contiguous ranges) such that the mapping is order-preserving. The domain and codomain are specified by the user, but the image and the individual mappings are generated. When adding a new value, the map is extended if there is a free space in the codomain that allows order to be preserved. If not, existing inputs are remapped to accommodate the new value if possible. In this case is triggered. If the codomain is too small to accommodate the new value is thrown.

member.summary: Thrown when the codomain is completely exhausted.

member.summary: Constructor.

Value.

member.summary: Attempt to extend the map to accommodate a new value x.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.OrderPreservingMap.TryExtendDomain(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a value to the domain of the map, changing the individual mappings as necessary. Tries to extend the map without changing any existing mappings. Triggers and returns false if existing mappings must be changed in order to accommodate the new value. Returns true otherwise. Throws if there is no room left in the codomain for another value.
member.param: The value to add to the domain.

member.summary: Applies the map to a value. Throws if value doesn't exist in map.
member.param: The value to apply the map to.
member.returns: The result of applying the map to the value.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.OrderPreservingMap.Populate(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Populate the map such that it contains all of the specified values. Try to spread the values out to avoid future remappings. Triggers . Throws if the codomain is too small for the given values.

member.name: T:Google.Maps.Util.Profiler
member.summary: A manual profiling class that collects timing data for named events.
member.remarks: Can be used to track time used in selected code sections through the use of named counters. These counters record total time spent, and number of intervals measured. A report (string) may be generated giving the total time, average time and number of recorded intervals for each named timer.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MinSupportedTerrainMeshResolution
member.summary: The minimum supported resolution for terrain mesh generation.
member.remarks: A terrain mesh resolution must be a power of 2 + 1.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MaxSupportedTerrainMeshResolution
member.summary: The maximum supported resolution for terrain mesh generation.
member.remarks: A terrain mesh resolution must be a power of 2 + 1.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MinSupportedTerrainBaseMapResolution
member.summary: The minimum supported resolution for the base map texture. This is the composite texture used on the terrain when viewed from a distance greater than the base map distance, as defined in the terrain's object.
member.remarks: Unity enforces a power-of-two square texture size for the base map texture. The minimum size that Unity allows is 16 pixels.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MaxSupportedTerrainBaseMapResolution
member.summary: The maximum supported resolution for the base map texture. This is the composite texture used on the terrain when viewed from a distance greater than the base map distance, as defined in the terrain's object.
member.remarks: Unity enforces a power-of-two square texture size for the base map texture. The maximum size that Unity allows is 2048 pixels.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MinSupportedTerrainAlphaMapResolution
member.summary: The minimum supported resolution for the alpha map textures. The alpha map textures are used to mask different s on top of the terrain.
member.remarks: Unity enforces a power-of-two square texture size for alpha map textures. The minimum size that Unity allows is 16 pixels.

member.name: F:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MaxSupportedTerrainAlphaMapResolution
member.summary: The maximum supported resolution for the alpha map textures. The alpha map textures are used to mask different s on top of the terrain.
member.remarks: Unity enforces a power-of-two square texture size for alpha map textures. The maximum size that Unity allows is 2048 pixels.

member.name: M:Google.Maps.Util.TerrainUtils.MetersPerPointToMeshResolution(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a power of two + 1 mesh resolution for a terrain tile of the specified zoom level. The returned resolution is decided such that if a mesh of that resolution were applied to such a terrain tile, it would match the provided meters per point value as closely as possible.
member.param: The desired distance between each point in meters.
The resolution will be calculated to apply to tiles of this zoom level.

The returned resolution is decided such that if a texture of that resolution were applied to such a terrain tile, it would match the provided meters per pixel value as closely as possible.
member.param: The desired distance between each pixel in meters.
The resolution will be calculated to apply to tiles of this zoom level.

The resolution will be calculated to apply to tiles of this zoom level.
